intro: Hieracium subgaudinii, commonly known as the Gaudin's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of northern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and rocky soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium subgaudinii is often found in open habitats such as meadows and along roadsides.
